# Research

My research areas are macroeconomics and time series econometrics, with a focus on the estimation of forecasts and impulse response functions (IRFs), as well as the impact of expectations on business cycles. Below are selected papers that highlight my work:

- Local Projections Are VAR Predictions of Increasing Order [[Download This Paper](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/abstract_id=4882149){target="_blank"}]

- Identification of Rational Expectations Models Under Information Frictions [[Download This Paper](research/Ludwig ID of RE Models under IF.pdf){target="_blank"}]

- The Effects of Expectation: Evidence from Text-Based Infectious Disease Data (with [Ram Joshi](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ram-joshi-694b09158/){target="_blank"} and [Xiaohan Ma](https://sites.google.com/view/xiaohanma){target="_blank"}) [[Download This Paper](https://ssrn.com/abstract=4844096){target="_blank"}]

- Diverging Macroeconomic Expectations and Business Cycles (with [Xiaohan Ma](https://sites.google.com/view/xiaohanma){target="_blank"}) [[Download This Paper](https://ssrn.com/abstract=4739011){target="_blank"}]

- Disentangling Intrinsic and Informational Uncertainty (with [Xiaohan Ma](https://sites.google.com/view/xiaohanma){target="_blank"})

- Oil Prices and Inequality (with [Xiaowen Lei](https://sites.google.com/site/lysfxiaowen/home){target="_blank"} and [Xiaohan Ma](https://sites.google.com/view/xiaohanma){target="_blank"})

#### Textbook

"Economic Data Analysis" by Julian F. Ludwig, accessible for free at [www.julianfludwig.com/eda](https://www.julianfludwig.com/eda){target="_blank"} (preliminary version). This text explains how to use software to present economic and financial data. It is recommended for courses ECO 3323, ECO 3363, and ECO 3364.
